channel.title: Amherst College Public Events occurring between Monday, November 4, 2024 12:12 PM EST and Wednesday, December 4, 2024 12:12 PM EST
channel.description: A listing of public events for Amherst College occurring between Monday, November 4, 2024 12:12 PM EST and Wednesday, December 4, 2024 12:12 PM EST.

item.title: Weekly Discretionary
item.description:
Weekly Discretionary

Join the AAS Budgetary Committee (BC) to request funding from the AAS Discretionary Fund for any student activities you wish to put on! Prior to arriving, please review the funding policies and put your name, the club you are representing, and what you are asking for here under the appropriate week. Please forward any questions to budgetary@amherst.edu or reach out to your BC Representatives listed here. 

From Monday, November 4, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall.
item.location: Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall
item.author: aas@amherst.edu (Association of Amherst Students (AAS))

item.title: AISA (AI Safety @ Amherst) Speaker Event: Eddie Zhang
item.description:
AISA (AI Safety @ Amherst) Speaker Event: Eddie Zhang
Join us on November 5th from 4-5 PM in Science Center E108 to hear OpenAI Resident and Harvard PhD student Eddie Zhang's talk on AI safety! Presenting remotely, Eddie will give an overview of AI Safety research projects at OpenAI and speak about his new non-profit Humanity Unleashed, which aims to develop AI tools to improve the government's ability to predict outcomes of economic and policy interventions.After the talk, there will be an informal mingling session for students across the five Colleges to network and discuss their thoughts on AI safety and governance. Food from Royal Chicken & Kebab will be provided. Interested attendees should RSVP by Friday, Nov 1st. You can either scan the QR code or use this link: https://forms.gle/Z12X2dsqnrnAtHt37

From Tuesday, November 5, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:00 PM EST at SCCE E108.
item.author: aisa@amherst.edu (‭Artificial Intelligence Safety at Amherst)

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Tuesday, November 5, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EST at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
item.description:
Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting

Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...

From Tuesday, November 5, 2024 5:30 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending).
item.location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)
item.author: mhauschildt25@amherst.edu (Theatrical Choreography Club)

item.title: Queer and Questioning
item.description:
Queer and Questioning

Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.

From Tuesday, November 5, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Queer Resource Center.

item.title: Keefe Campus Center Election Watch Party
item.description:
Keefe Campus Center Election Watch Party
Join Student Affairs along with student organizations for a Keefe Campus Center takeover, Election Watch Party. All three floors of Keefe will have interactive experiences to engage in during the election along with food and resources! All programming will run from 7 p.m. - 10 p.m. with the Friedman Room viewing continuing until midnight!
 
What is happening and where? 
6pm-7pm vigil at Memorial Hill
Religious and Spiritual Life - Keefe 017 - RSL chaplains are here to offer pastoral guidance and support to our community.
Jose Marti Room - Speak Spanish? Want to be in community with others who do? Join student leaders from La Causa for a Spanish broadcast from Telemundo or Univisonn. 
Keefe Atrium - Check out our map of the US. States will be colored in as results roll in. Stop by throughout the night to see how things are going. 
Grab n Go - Late Night is popping up in Grab n Go! Stop by from 9p-11p for your regularly scheduled late night snacking! 
Mail Room - Drinks and cookies from Late Night available in the mail room! 
Wellbeing Makerspace - Keefe 101- Drop in the Wellbeing Makerspace to join the Peer Educators for Powering Down from the Polls, a community-arts event. This is a space to take a break and unplug from the election. 
Student Engagement and Leadership- Keefe 102 - Does decompressing involve Mario Kart or maybe Just Dance? Pop into Student Engagement and Leadership for some Switch gaming. 
Friedman Room - MSNBC will be on from 7p-12a, and students from the Amherst College Democrats will be in the space hanging out with you. 
Keefe 203 - Fox News Broadcast 
 
Additional watch parties in Center for International Student Engagement, Multicultural Resource Center, Queer Resource Center, Women and Gender Center, and Class Action Resource Center!
 
 
What is Late Night serving?
- Queso Bravo Dip
- Chicken Bacon Ranch
- Tomato Salsa
- Black Bean and Corn Salsa
- Tortilla Chips
- Cookies
- Canned Beverages 
 
What kind of resources are available? 
Amherst College staff will be around in spaces until 10 p.m. ready to chat about the elections and how you are feeling. Garett Fitzgerald from the Center for Counseling and Mental Health (CCMH) and the Wellness Team will be available in the Powerhouse from 6:30-10 p.m. for a quiet space to talk more. 
 
What can I do while I wait for election night? 
Be sure to check out TurboVotes and make sure you are registered to vote and know how to vote! If you want to participate in a contest, check out our 270 to Win contest and enter to win! 
 
Who do I contact if I want to help out, have a question or need to request an accommodation? 
Please reach out to SEL@amherst.edu and Student Engagement and Leadership staff will connect with you. 

From Tuesday, November 5, 2024 7:00 PM to 11:45 PM EST at Keefe Campus Center.
item.author: sel@amherst.edu (Student Engagement and Leadership)

item.title: First Gen Wednesdays Get Together!!
item.description:
First Gen Wednesdays Get Together!!

Start the day strong! The First Gen CRG will be providing apple cider & apple themed snacks – staff, faculty and students alike are welcomed!

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 9:30 AM to 10:30 AM EST at Mead Art Museum.

item.title: Destress or Distract with QRC & CARC!
item.description:
Destress or Distract with QRC & CARC!

Need some time to destress or distract after Election Day? You can pick between two spaces: 1) you can crochet cute animals at CARC, which will be a quieter, crafty mindful space! or 2) you can play card and board games with friends at the QRC for a more fun, lively time! 

No experience required! Pizza and boba will be provided ~ 

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 11:30 AM to 1:00 PM EST at Keefe Campus Center 2nd Floor.

item.title: Popcorn Pop-in
item.description:
Popcorn Pop-in

Pop in to Student Engagement and Leadership every Wednesday for popcorn and conversation! A special topping every week, good company, and a time to ask questions about your organizations. We can't wait to see you!

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM EST at Keefe Campus Center 102.
item.author: sel@amherst.edu (Student Engagement and Leadership)

item.title: Proofing Party!
item.description:
Proofing Party!

Join us for a fun and collaborative Proofing Party! This event is perfect for anyone who enjoys working with words, refining content, or just wants to lend a keen eye to important documents. We’ll be gathering to review and polish The Indicator, ensuring it’s clear, engaging, and error-free.

Bring your editing skills, attention to detail, and a good sense of humor as we work together to make this publication shine. Dinner (from Formosa!) will be provided to keep the energy going. Whether you’re a grammar guru, a spelling savant, or just want to help out, we welcome you to be part of this collective effort!

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM EST at Pemberton Lounge.
item.author: theindicator@amherst.edu (The Indicator)

item.title: APU Election Debrief — Pizza and Politics
item.description:
APU Election Debrief — Pizza and Politics

Join APU to discuss and digest the election results with pizza! This event is a chance to unwind, connect with your peers, and more deeply understand the political landscape following the election. All perspectives are welcome.

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Frost 211.
item.author: llubyprikot26@amherst.edu (Political Union)

item.title: "Cultivating" Health - Stories of Filipino Farmworkers
item.description:
"Cultivating" Health - Stories of Filipino Farmworkers

Public Health Collaborative is partnering with LUNAS Global Health Network to discuss how climate change has disproportionately affected the Philippines and their farmers. Formosa catering will be provided. 

 

This event will be held 7:30-8:30 in the science center, in Lipton lecture hall - E 110. 

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Lipton Lecture Hall E110 .
item.author: ac.publichealthcollab@gmail.com (Public Health Collaborative)

item.title: Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
item.description:
Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting

Come join the Food Justice Alliance for our weekly meeting! At our general meetings, we might discuss food justice issues, plan key events like collaborations with the Book & Plow Farm, cook or bake together, coordinate the Food Recovery Program @ Val or other volunteer opportunities, and much more. Come join us in Chapin 204 at 8pm every week!

From Wednesday, November 6, 2024 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM EST at Chapin 204.

Every Thursday at 5:30pm in the Queer Resource Center, located on the 2nd floor of Keefe Campus Center, QTPOC (Queer Trans People of Color Collective) host weekly discussions and activities for queer students of color! We will always have snacks, games, and fun activities to help you get away from the noise of the campus!

item.title: Poetry Parlor
item.description:
Poetry Parlor

The Poetry Club is profoundly proud to present the Prose and Poetry Parlor! Come share and talk about your writing — of any form or style — in an open, supportive, and informal space. We will host open mics, workshop-style discussions, low-stakes writing challenges — the sky's the limit! With these biweekly gatherings, we hope to provide an environment that encourages and connects the writing community on campus. Come visit us at Pemberton Lounge!

From Thursday, November 7, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Pemberton Lounge.

item.title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
item.description:
Amherst Cricket Club Practices
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

From Thursday, November 7, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EST at Amherst Alumni Gym (Coolidge Cage).
item.author: dmavani25@amherst.edu (Amherst College Cricket Club)

item.title: Study Away 101
item.description:
Study Away 101

Are you considering studying away for a semester (or two!)? We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

From Friday, November 8, 2024 11:30 AM to 12:15 PM EST at Classroom 211, Frost Library.
item.author: geo@amherst.edu (Global Education Office)

item.title: FLI Freshmen and Faculty Lunch with Dean Vigil
item.description:
FLI Freshmen and Faculty Lunch with Dean Vigil

Craving food from Formosa and Ginger Garden? First Generation and Low Income first-years are all invited to this casual lunch with Dean Vigil. HOWEVER, there is a fun twist! You can invite your favorite professors from this semester and enjoy a meal with them. This is an opportunity to get to know your professor, ask questions about office hours, and build connections. Don't miss out - RSVP with this link! 

From Friday, November 8, 2024 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM EST at O'Connor Common .

item.title: Paths of Possibilities: Alumni Panel
item.description:
Paths of Possibilities: Alumni Panel

Are you curious about graduate school or working in industry as a Math or Stats major? We cordially invite interested students, staff, and faculty to join our Alumni Panel Discussion. In Petkova (c/o '06), Michelle Ngo (c/o '15), and Tara Yoo (c/o '15) will be sharing their insights about graduate students and career paths. Food from El Comalito will be served! Hosted by the MS-DEI Fellows, CARC, CISE, SEL, and ISA! 

 

RSVP HERE!!! 

From Saturday, November 9, 2024 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Friedmann Room.

item.title: Diwali Celebration
item.description:
Diwali Celebration

Join the South Asian Student Association for our annual Diwali celebration. There will be lots of free and delicious Indian food in addition to live student performances. We will also have a henna station where some students will be making henna designs for others, or you can try your own hand at henna. We will also be creating rangoli with marigolds and would love for you to contribute to our communal rangoli creation. Come by and stay as long or as little as you'd like to support your fellow students, learn more, and celebrate with us!

From Saturday, November 9, 2024 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM EST at The Powerhouse.
item.author: sasa@amherst.edu (South Asian Students Association)

item.title: Cookstove Project - Saving Women and Childrens' Health in Uganda and Nepal
item.description:
Cookstove Project - Saving Women and Childrens' Health in Uganda and Nepal

Cookstove project aims to eliminate the preventable deaths in developing countries that are caused by cooking with a three stone open fire. Nearly 2.3 billion people, about 1/3 the world's population prepare food for their families using an open fire in their home.  This inefficient cooking method exposes users to dangerous pollutants.
They train and supervise families in the process of building and maintaining their own clean cookstoves. In order to keep costs low and to ensure the organic growth of the project, they mostly use local materials that are readily accessible to homeowners. Each stove is custom made to accommodate the cooking pots used in the home. The project emphasizes personal and community ownership, which ensures that the stoves will continue to be used for years to come.  

Amherst College Public Health Collaborative will be holding a conversation about how this project marries sustainability and health, and also how cooking affects womens' and childrens' health in developing countries. 

From Monday, November 11, 2024 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM EST at Room E212.
item.author: ac.publichealthcollab@gmail.com (Public Health Collaborative)

item.title: Building Green: Sustainable and Socially Just Architecture
item.description:
Building Green: Sustainable and Socially Just Architecture

Join EJA for a panel and dinner about sustainable architecture! We will be speaking with Professor Dwight Carey (Amherst College), Professor Naomi Darling (Mount Holyoke College), and Professor Robert Ryan (UMass). Attendees will learn about our speakers' backgrounds in career paths, the importance of sustainable design, and how architecture and urban planning can reinforce (or contradict) social justice principles. Dinner will be provided!

 

Hosted with support from SEL and the Amherst College Architectural Studies Program.

From Tuesday, November 12, 2024 5:30 PM to 7:30 PM EST at Friedman Room.
item.author: mhuq25@amherst.edu (Environmental Justice Alliance)

item.title: Queer and Questioning
item.description:
Queer and Questioning

Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.

From Tuesday, November 12, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Queer Resource Center (Keefe 213) .

item.title: FLI Week Bonfire & S'mores
item.description:
FLI Week Bonfire & S'mores

Take a break with studying and enjoy some s'mores with us in celebration of FLI week!! 

From Tuesday, November 12, 2024 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM EST at Keefe Campus FirePit.

item.title: Popcorn Pop-in
item.description:
Popcorn Pop-in

Pop in to Student Engagement and Leadership every Wednesday for popcorn and conversation! A special topping every week, good company, and a time to ask questions about your organizations. We can't wait to see you!

From Wednesday, November 13, 2024 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM EST at Keefe Campus Center 102.
item.author: sel@amherst.edu (Student Engagement and Leadership)

item.title: Freshly FLI Dance Break!
item.description:
Freshly FLI Dance Break!

Get your movement in and take a break from studying with Just Dance! Open to all students! There will be pizza and snacks!

From Wednesday, November 13, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Friedmann Room.

item.title: Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
item.description:
Food Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting

Come join the Food Justice Alliance for our weekly meeting! At our general meetings, we might discuss food justice issues, plan key events like collaborations with the Book & Plow Farm, cook or bake together, coordinate the Food Recovery Program @ Val or other volunteer opportunities, and much more. Come join us in Chapin 204 at 8pm every week!

From Wednesday, November 13, 2024 8:00 PM to 9:00 PM EST at Chapin 204.
item.author: acfoodjustice@gmail.com (Food Justice Alliance)

item.title: Hub Happy Hour
item.description:
Hub Happy Hour

Have questions about using the Hub? Maybe about planning an event, leading your RSO, recruiting or more? Stop into Keefe 102 on Thursdays from 3:30-4:30 pm to talk with Director of Student Engagement and Leadership about your group over a Polar Seltzer. 

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM EST at Keefe Campus Center 102 .
item.author: sel@amherst.edu (Student Engagement and Leadership)

item.title: Study Away 101
item.description:
Study Away 101

Are you considering studying away for a semester (or two!)? We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. Students are expected to attend this info session before making an appointment with a GEO advisor.

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 4:00 PM to 4:45 PM EST at Classroom 211, Frost Library.
item.author: geo@amherst.edu (Global Education Office)

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EST at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.title: QTPOC Weekly Meeting
item.description:
QTPOC Weekly Meeting

Every Thursday at 5:30pm in the Queer Resource Center, located on the 2nd floor of Keefe Campus Center, QTPOC (Queer Trans People of Color Collective) host weekly discussions and activities for queer students of color! We will always have snacks, games, and fun activities to help you get away from the noise of the campus!

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 5:30 PM to 6:30 PM EST at Queer Resource Center 2nd Floor of Keefe.
item.location: Queer Resource Center 2nd Floor of Keefe
item.author: qtpoc-l@amherst.edu (Queer and Trans People of Color Collective)

Practice with us

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:30 PM EST at Chapin 203.

item.description:

Join us for an informal study session with free food/drinks and good company! All gender identities and majors welcome!

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EST at Science Center E212.

item.title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
item.description:
Amherst Cricket Club Practices
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

From Thursday, November 14, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EST at Amherst Alumni Gym (Coolidge Cage).
item.author: dmavani25@amherst.edu (Amherst College Cricket Club)

item.title: Queer Talk
item.description:
Queer Talk

Join us at the QRC for Queer Talk, a weekly conversation about queerness with a new theme every week! Don’t miss it!!

From Friday, November 15, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:00 PM EST at Queer Resource Center (Keefe 213).

item.title: Archery Practice @ Sattva Archery Range
item.description:
Archery Practice @ Sattva Archery Range

Weekly archery practice at the Sattva range in Northampton. Connect with the club on our GroupMe if you are interested in joining! 

From Friday, November 15, 2024 4:30 PM to 7:30 PM EST at Sattva Center for Archery Training, Northampton, MA.
item.location: Sattva Center for Archery Training, Northampton, MA

item.title: 3D meeting!!!!!!!
item.description:
3D meeting!!!!!!!

3D (Making a Difference for the Developmentally Disabled) Meeting!!

From Sunday, November 17, 2024 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM EST at Conway Classroom (in Alumni Gym).
item.author: varmour25@amherst.edu (3D: Difference for the Developmentally Disabled)

item.title: Weekly Discretionary
item.description:
Weekly Discretionary

Join the AAS Budgetary Committee (BC) to request funding from the AAS Discretionary Fund for any student activities you wish to put on! Prior to arriving, please review the funding policies and put your name, the club you are representing, and what you are asking for here under the appropriate week. Please forward any questions to budgetary@amherst.edu or reach out to your BC Representatives listed here. 

From Monday, November 18, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall.
item.location: Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall
item.author: aas@amherst.edu (Association of Amherst Students (AAS))

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Tuesday, November 19, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EST at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.description:

Are you considering studying away for a semester (or two!)? We'll be covering the basics of the process for both international and domestic programs, including what programs are available, financial considerations, when to start applications, and more. item.author: geo@amherst.edu (Global Education Office)

item.title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
item.description:
Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting

Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...

From Tuesday, November 19, 2024 5:30 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending).
item.location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)
item.author: mhauschildt25@amherst.edu (Theatrical Choreography Club)

item.title: Amherst Cricket Club Practices
item.description:
Amherst Cricket Club Practices
Dear Cricketers,
 
This semester's practices are scheduled on the following times at a weekly cadence in Coolidge Cage (Alumni Gym aka Tennis Courts):
  • Thursday 8-10 pm
  • Saturday 3-5 pm
So, the INTRO-meeting is (12th Sept) THIS THURSDAY 8-10 pm!!! Equipment & Snacks/Drinks Covered!
 
Before that, as per the Amherst College rules, please fill out the waiver below so that we can start the ball rolling! And, I have also sent all of you invites on the Hub to join the club, so please accept the invite there to stay posted! (GroupMe: https://groupme.com/join_group/97352198/c7Az2Nim)

How do I sign the waiver?

Link: https://risk-management.mtholyoke.edu/waivers/login.php

Once logged in, you should click on Waiver Form in the top left-hand corner, and then select the following from the drop-down menus:

College: Amherst College
Activity Type: Student Group
Activity Name: Amherst College Cricket Club

After that you will be prompted to sign and fill in your background information!

Thank you so much for your support and patience throughout this!

Take care,

Founder & President of Cricket Club

From Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EST at Amherst Alumni Gym (Coolidge Cage).
item.author: dmavani25@amherst.edu (Amherst College Cricket Club)

item.title: Shabbat Dinner
item.description:
Shabbat Dinner

Please join us for Shabbat Dinner every Friday night in the Friedmann Room (second floor of Keefe Campus Center)! We provide a catered meal from a local restaurant, bakery challah, dessert, and some lovely Jewish conversation. Please contact hillel@amherst.edu or scolt@amherst.edu with questions.

From Friday, November 22, 2024 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM EST at Friedmann Room, Keefe Campus Center.

item.title: Mammoth MakerLab Weekly Meetings
item.description:
Mammoth MakerLab Weekly Meetings

Join us every Sunday at 8:00 p.m. in SCCE A113 to work on/develop a creative project using a 3D printer, laser cutter, resin printer, Arduino board, or soldering kit. No previous experience required!

From Sunday, December 1, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EST at Amherst College Science Center A113.
item.author: dtheiler26@amherst.edu (Mammoth Makerspace)

item.title: Weekly Discretionary
item.description:
Weekly Discretionary

Join the AAS Budgetary Committee (BC) to request funding from the AAS Discretionary Fund for any student activities you wish to put on! Prior to arriving, please review the funding policies and put your name, the club you are representing, and what you are asking for here under the appropriate week. Please forward any questions to budgetary@amherst.edu or reach out to your BC Representatives listed here. 

From Monday, December 2, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall.
item.location: Cole Assembly Room (Red Room), Converse Hall
item.author: aas@amherst.edu (Association of Amherst Students (AAS))

item.title: Weekly Meeting

Weekly Meeting

Our weekly AAS meeting where we pass Budgetary reccomendations and discuss issues on campus.

From Monday, December 2, 2024 8:30 PM to 9:30 PM EST at Red Room, Converse Hall.

item.title: Fencing Club Practice
item.description:
Fencing Club Practice

The anatomy of a typical fencing club meeting is as follows:

1) Warmup: We might play a quick game involving running, or we may just jog for a minute or two

2) Stretching: Stretching is important before working out!

3) Footwork: Footwork is key to fencing! We practice it each meeting to make sure we've got it down, and play some footwork-based games

4) Bladework: We break out the swords and learn how to use them!

5) Fencing: We set up electric scoring equipment and fence each other with the remaining time

This semester, we are meeting Tuesdays and Thursdays at 4-5:30 in Middleton Gym!

For more information, contact mammothfencing@gmail.com!

From Tuesday, December 3, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM EST at Alumni Gym (Middleton Gym).
item.author: mammothfencing@gmail.com (Amherst College Fencing Club)

item.title: Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting
item.description:
Regular Theatrical Choreography Club (TCC) Meeting

Gather one and all to practice your sword (among other weapons) combat against friend and foe alike, SAFELY. To create great spectacles and drama is terrific on its own but what if you added WEAPONS (AND SAFETY). If the likes of the Princess Bride or Pirates of the Caribbean have ever gotten your blood rushing and riled up your instinct to pick up a roughly sword-shaped object, then this is the place for you to indulge those desires, SAFELY. So join us if you dare, but only if you are prepared for a fun (and safe) time...

From Tuesday, December 3, 2024 5:30 PM to 7:00 PM EST at Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending).
item.location: Middleton Gym - Alumni Gym OR Front of Alumni Gym (Weather Depending)
item.author: mhauschildt25@amherst.edu (Theatrical Choreography Club)

item.title: Queer and Questioning
item.description:
Queer and Questioning

Do you have questions about queerness? Are you exploring your identity? Are you in need of a space to discuss anything gender and/or sexuality related with no labels involved? Then stop by our student-led support group at Keefe 203, every Tuesday at 7:30 pm. All sessions are private and do not require regular involvement! No college staff/faculty will be present during the sessions.

From Tuesday, December 3, 2024 7:30 PM to 8:30 PM EST at Queer Resource Center (Keefe 213).

item.title: Hub Happy Hour
item.description:
Hub Happy Hour

Have questions about using The Hub? Maybe about planning an event, leading your RSO, recruiting or more? Stop into Keefe 102 on Thursdays from 3:30-4:30 pm to talk with Director of Student Engagement and Leadership about your group over a Polar seltzer.

From Thursday, November 7, 2024 3:30 PM to Thursday, December 5, 2024 4:30 PM EST at Keefe 102.
item.author: sel@amherst.edu (Student Engagement and Leadership)
